item.title: Scrum: Stages of Grief
item.description: Scrum is a methodology to organize team work. Created by Jeff Sutherland and Ken Schwaber in the early 1990s, it is a perfect example of combining tried and true ideas from the Orient and the Occident until you arrive at something novel. In the case of Scrum, the problem it sought to initially solve is how to develop enterprise software in a way that actually creates value to end users.
